Key Match Events: Sri Lanka and India played out a sensational tied encounter in the first ODI at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo on August 2, 2024.
Rohit Sharma scored a half-century (58 off 47 balls) with 7 fours and 3 sixes.
Dunith Wellalage took two crucial wickets, including that of Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill.
Wanindu Hasaranga took three wickets for 58 runs, including the key wicket of Virat Kohli.
Charith Asalanka took three wickets for 30 runs, including the final two wickets to tie the match.
Pathum Nissanka scored 56 runs off 75 balls for Sri Lanka.
Dunith Wellalage scored an unbeaten 67 off 65 balls to help Sri Lanka post a total of 230 for eight.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a tricky pitch that offered considerable assistance to the spinners.
Sri Lanka avoided an 11th straight defeat to India across formats by tying the match.
